qas.question: What government body does Socatel regulate in telecommunications?
What is a major radio station provider in CAR?
What does Socatel get help with from ITU-D?
What group helps Socatel with telecommunications?
What group is a part of Socatel and helps the CAR with telecommunications?

context: Presently, the Central African Republic has active television services, radio stations, <a2_0>internet service<a2_0/> providers, and mobile phone carriers; <a0_0><b6_0>Socatel<b6_0/><a0_0/> is the leading provider for both internet and mobile phone access throughout the country. The primary governmental regulating bodies of telecommunications are <b5_0>the <a1_0>Ministère des Postes and Télécommunications et des Nouvelles Technologies<b5_0/><a1_0/>. In addition, the Central African Republic receives international support on telecommunication related operations from <a3_0><b8_0><b9_0>ITU Telecommunication Development Sector<b9_0/><b8_0/><a3_0/> (ITU-D) within the International Telecommunication Union to <a4_0><b7_0>improve infrastructure<b7_0/><a4_0/>.
